main event: On September 7, 1956, an observer reported seeing a bright silver oval object, about the size of a basketball, hovering 15 feet above the ground in Dayton, Ohio.
interesting points: The object hovered before moving away when the observer flashed a light at it., The brightness of the object was noted to be equivalent to a diameter of 5 to 8 feet., The observer estimated the object's speed to be between 1500 to 2000 mph., The weather conditions included clear skies for the observation., The observer believed that the object was some form of air vehicle.
sighted object: One oval object, silver in color
witness description: The observer, a 19-year-old male, who was familiar with many types of aircraft.
